title: Meritxell Relano
subtitle: 52% of all refugees are children. A refugee crisis is a child's crisis. #RefugeeForum Inclusion and access to national social services is the best approach for refugee children. pic.twitter.com/HCehmlloT8

title: Counterpoints Arts
subtitle: Announcing the 2020 Refugee Week Conferences, in London and Bristol this February! Join us to explore how arts and culture can bring communities together and help change the conversation about #refugees. Book now: http://bit.ly/RWConference2020 … RTpic.twitter.com/Ewg8rvhQ9H

title: MARY... THE IRISH INSAFIAN
subtitle: PM @ImranKhanPTI will be visiting Geneva to co-convene the first ever Global Refugee Forum (GRF) commencing on 17 Dec 2019. PM Khan, President Erdogan, & leaders from Costa Rica, Ethiopia & Germanys exemplary role for the protection and well-being of refugees will be recognised pic.twitter.com/lQxVv5P7et

title: Meritxell Relano
subtitle:
An important discussion at the #RefugeeForum this morning on how investments in water & sanitation must serve the immediate needs of refugees & the long-term needs of communities and countries.

title: Ireland UN Geneva
subtitle: Great meeting with @IOMchief this morning at #RefugeeForum to discuss cooperation between Ireland and @IOM - essential partner in implementing Global Compacts on Refugees and Migration. Look forward to welcoming you to Ireland in 2020. pic.twitter.com/1cyQf0WYct

title: Phyll Opoku-Gyimah
subtitle: My Chosen Family: Some of the @ukblackpride team met on Sunday to reflect, debrief and plan for 2020. It’s going to be our 15th year - stay tuned for some ‘MAJOR’ announcements and opportunities to join the family! #LGBTQI+ #Black #Brown #PoC #Diaspora #Migrants #Refugees  pic.twitter.com/ofrisZZXUE – at Mama Shelter London

title: Cameron Calder
subtitle: Kent refugee network spokesperson on Sky news. If ever a woman looked like a handwringer. pic.twitter.com/gctPqk85Ef

title: Phil Arnold
subtitle: Italy commits to direct transfer of refugees from Libya and calls on all European countries to do same and support other safe legal pathways. #RefugeesForumpic.twitter.com/yBlxSutov1

title: GermanForeignOffice
subtitle: "Only 20% of the states participate in taking care of over 70 Mio. refugees. The message of the #RefugeeForum must therefore be: more solidarity in dealing with refugees, more international cooperation, more multilateralism." Foreign Minister @HeikoMaas in Geneva.pic.twitter.com/loXiwSF01K

title: Davide Vignati
subtitle: The 1st Global Refugee Forum co-hosted by #UNHCR and Switzerland comes at the end of a tumultuous decade in which the number of refugees has risen to over 25mio people worldwide. The #RefugeeForum is an opportunity to translate the principle of responsibility-sharing into actionpic.twitter.com/b7LFr3WOkW

title: IOM Indonesia
subtitle:

title: Nasir Andisha
subtitle: The #GlobalRefugeeForum begin with cohosts introduction.UNSG @antonioguterres has a poignant msg:Generosity is not correlated to wealth of nations when it comes to supporting refugee. title: IGADGRF
subtitle: Mr. Moumin Ahmed Chieck, Minister for Interior for the Republic of Djibouti tables the country statement at the #RefugeeForum Commits to extend support for tertiary education to refugees. title: Filippo Grandi
subtitle:
The night before the start of the #RefugeeForum, with some of the refugee delegates representing their communities or refugee organizations...
